content.description: If tiny crimps and lock-offs are your thing.
content.location: Sit start with good holds at waist level and a low feet. Make long moves to tiny crimps. Continue above as juggy holds become more available.

content.description: Decent traverse along good features. Decent warm-up option.
content.protection: Pads along entire length of wall.
content.location: Same start as the V0 arete climb on the left side of the boulder face. Go up and upon reaching halfway up the boulder wall, start traversing right with pleasing, wavy-like features. Same top out as Key Grip on the right arete.

content.description: Good arete climb with tricky start feet. Brush those holds! Bad landing.
content.location: Crouch start with holds low on the arete. Climb the arete and move onto the left face to top out.

content.description: Powerful moves on relatively generous sidepulls. The generous feet on other parts of the wall somewhat disappear here.
content.location: Same start as Soft Opening. Traverse right on decent right sidepulls to merge with Key Grip.

content.description: An obvious traverse line that seemed to have been missed when this boulder was established. Fun and smooth traverse on finger-friendly holds to a powerful iron-cross crux sequence.
content.location: Matched sit start using the good side pull starting hold as Crack (V1). Traverse right using good crimp holds and feet. Merge into Soft Opening with same top out.

content.description: Good start to decent side pull crimps along the crack.
content.location: Sit start on good left hand side pull and right hand undercling. Climb the face and crack.

content.description: Underrated problem with a technical start using the slopes undercling feature.
content.location: Sit start right of the small arete to the right of the upside down on juggy crimps. Move up using the slopes undercling feature and delicate crimps. Top out above.

content.description: First developed by Donny Hardin, Andrew Fulton, and Joe Fulton in 1994 and later by John Ahriman in 1997. Much of the climbs are crispy with good to decent feet. Relatively easy top-puts albeit more beach whaling than one would think.
